## Introduction
This vignette demonstrates how to use the `Estimater` package for binary classification.
We use the `adult` dataset to predict whether an individual's income is above $50K.

## Loading and Preprocessing Data
```{r}
# Load required libraries
library(Estimater)

# Load the dataset
data <- read.csv("adult(1).csv", sep = ";")

# Clean the data: Convert income to binary outcome (1: >50K, 0: <=50K)
data$Income <- ifelse(data$"NA" == " >50K", 1, 0)

# Select relevant features
X <- data[, c("age", "education.num", "hours.per.week", "capital.gain", "capital.loss")]
y <- data$Income

# Calculate initial coefficients
beta_init <- beta_initial(X, y)
print(beta_init)

# Optimize coefficients using numerical optimization (if function is implemented)
beta_optimized <- optimize_coefficients(X, y, init = beta_init)
print(beta_optimized)

# Generate bootstrap confidence intervals
boot_intervals <- bootstrap_confidence(X, y, num_bootstrap = 50, alpha = 0.05)
print(boot_intervals)

# Generate predictions
predictions <- predict_binary(beta_optimized, X)

# Compute confusion matrix and metrics
metrics <- compute_metrics(y, predictions)
print(metrics)
